alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 11:41AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Additional rainfall Sunday afternoon and evening will keep the Little Popo Agie River running high overnight. The rain should lessen early Monday morning and showers and thunderstorms are not expected to be as widespread Monday. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until 600 AM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas, with the best chance of flooding in Lyons Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 AM MDT, Sunday, June 4, a secondary wave of water was working its way downstream from Red Canyon to Hudson. The river is expected to crest in Lyons Valley Sunday afternoon. Minor flooding of the river and its smaller tributaries is expected until around sunrise Monday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyons Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
